comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The picture shows the Siemens-Schuckert Werke [S.S.W.] L.I as correctly identified in this scan of a German book also in the SDASM collection. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/5956285252/] The S.S.W L.I was the only type developed during the war (end 1918 / beginning 1919) of a new class. The L-class was positioned between the G-class [Grossflugzeug - with two engines] and the R-class [Riesenflugzeuge]. The design started life as the Siemens-Schuckert G.III (the G.I and G.II were projects only), but this was quickly changed to L.I. It is given that the machine was modeled on the successful Italian Caproni bombers. There is no evidence that this machine was designed by the Steffen brothers.
